---
title: "odbc"
---

The odbc package provides a DBI-compliant interface to Open Database Connectivity (ODBC) drivers. It allows for an efficient, easy way to setup connection to any database using an ODBC driver, including Databricks.

## What's new?

The new `odbc::databricks()` function has built-in ways to determine and set most of the connection settings.

### [Install the driver »](https://solutions.posit.co/connections/db/databases/databricks/index.html#package-options)

Download the ODBC driver directly from the provider’s site: [Databricks ODBC Driver](https://www.databricks.com/spark/odbc-drivers-download).

::: {.callout-note}
Posit Workbench, RStudio Desktop Pro, Connect, or Shiny Server Pro users can download and use [Posit Professional Drivers](https://docs.posit.co/pro-drivers/) at no additional charge. These drivers include an ODBC connector for Databricks.

[Learn more »](posit-workbench.html#databricks-pro-driver)
:::

### [Get started »](https://solutions.posit.co/connections/db/databases/databricks/#package-options)

We recommend using the new `odbc::databricks()` function to connect to Databricks.

### [Interact with the cluster »](https://solutions.posit.co/connections/db/tooling/connections/)

You can explore and access data from your Databricks cluster directly in RStudio through the [Connections Pane](https://solutions.posit.co/connections/db/tooling/connections/).

### [Analyzing your data »]((https://solutions.posit.co/connections/db/r-packages/dplyr/))

You can use your familiar dplyr commands to prepare your data.

Check out the [Best Practices](https://solutions.posit.co/connections/db/best-practices/) page to learn about creating enterprise-ready dashboards, securing deployed content, and more.

### Deploying content to Posit Connect

Once you have created your content, deploy it to [Posit Connect](https://posit.co/products/enterprise/connect/).
